events.message: The customer reported filing a claim due to a car collision that caused significant front-end damage. The accident occurred on a busy street during rush hour.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after initial review confirmed it involved a vehicle collision on public roads.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case and contact the claimant for further details.
Acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the investigation would begin promptly to expedite the process.
Requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a detailed statement from the claimant regarding the accident circumstances.
The customer submitted all requested documents including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and witness statements.
Investigation was initiated to assess the fault and extent of the damage based on the evidence submitted and claimant's statement.
Completed investigation confirming that the claimant was not at fault and the damage estimate aligns with repair shop quotes.
Proposed settlement amount based on damage assessment was communicated to the claimant for approval and next steps.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and quick handling of the claim.
Official approval of the claim was granted following customer agreement to the settlement terms and documented acceptance.
The payment corresponding to the approved settlement was issued to the claimantâ€™s designated bank account on schedule.
Final status updated to closed as all claim procedures, payments, and customer satisfaction checks have been completed.
All claim documents and records were archived securely in accordance with company policy for future reference if needed.
